issue.title: www.emag.ro
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.emag.ro/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.emag.ro%2F) ### Comment > Hi! Please include this site as a false positive: https://www.emag.ro/ The main banners are not showing, when logged in my account, on a PC if Adguard protection is ON. This is a online store and they have great offers on that main banners and I would like to see it, in my browsers. I even used a reset on my PC for Adguard to cancel a hidden rule but it still not showing anything. > > Also, I think that it would be great that the Adguard assistant settings to also have a Unblock ad on this website option. I my case if I did push, by mistake, pushed the Block ad on this website and clicked on the main banner region I could easy and without any special knowledge undo my problem. That is why I've used the Adguard reset on my PC, but that did not worked. > > I saw that when I order something, sometimes when the pay section of the site is on display, on PC the screen is just white and I can't finish to process my payments. This I don't know if it's because of Adguard or not but it just became a problem in the past week, out of the blue. > > Thank you. Have a good day! ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/8d9w10V.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/9v1ISE3.jpg)

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
It looks like that something doesn't work correctly and probably server with filters is blocked.
To be honest I don't what's the reason, but for example it might be similar situation like here - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2185

You can try to add these rules:
```adblock
@@||imasdk.googleapis.com/js/sdkloader/ima3_dai.js$domain=cbs.com|paramountplus.com
@@||pubads.g.doubleclick.net/ondemand/*/content/*/vid/*/streams$domain=cbs.com|paramountplus.com
||pubads.g.doubleclick.net/ondemand/*/content/*/vid/*/streams/*/time-events.json$important,domain=cbs.com|paramountplus.com
cbs.com,paramountplus.com#%#(()=>{window.XMLHttpRequest.prototype.open=new Proxy(window.XMLHttpRequest.prototype.open,{apply:async(a,b,c)=>{const d=c[1];return"string"!=typeof d||0===d.length?Reflect.apply(a,b,c):(d.match(/pubads\.g\.doubleclick.net\/ondemand\/hls\/.*\.m3u8/)&&b.addEventListener("readystatechange",function(){if(4===b.readyState){const a=b.response;Object.defineProperty(b,"response",{writable:!0}),Object.defineProperty(b,"responseText",{writable:!0});const c=a.replaceAll(/#EXTINF:(\d|\d\.\d+)\,\nhttps:\/\/redirector\.googlevideo\.com\/videoplayback\?[\s\S]*?&source=dclk_video_ads&[\s\S]*?\n/g,"");b.response=c,b.responseText=c}}),Reflect.apply(a,b,c))}})})();
cbs.com,paramountplus.com#%#(()=>{const a=window.fetch;window.fetch=new Proxy(window.fetch,{apply:async(b,c,d)=>{const e=d[0];if("string"!=typeof e||0===e.length)return Reflect.apply(b,c,d);if(e.match(/pubads\.g\.doubleclick\.net\/ondemand\/.*\/content\/.*\/vid\/.*\/streams\/.*\/manifest\.mpd|pubads\.g\.doubleclick.net\/ondemand\/hls\/.*\.m3u8/)){const b=await a(...d);let c=await b.text();return c=c.replaceAll(/<Period id="(pre|mid|post)-roll-.-ad-[\s\S]*?>[\s\S]*?<\/Period>|#EXTINF:(\d|\d\.\d+)\,\nhttps:\/\/redirector\.googlevideo\.com\/videoplayback\?[\s\S]*?&source=dclk_video_ads&[\s\S]*?\n/g,""),new Response(c)}return Reflect.apply(b,c,d)}})})();
```
to user rules, but I think it would be better to find out a culprit why this error (with updating filters) occurs.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.emag.ro/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.emag.ro%2F) ### Comment > Hi! Please include this site as a false positive: https://www.emag.ro/ The main banners are not showing, when logged in my account, on a PC if Adguard protection is ON. This is a online store and they have great offers on that main banners and I would like to see it, in my browsers. I even used a reset on my PC for Adguard to cancel a hidden rule but it still not showing anything. > > Also, I think that it would be great that the Adguard assistant settings to also have a Unblock ad on this website option. I my case if I did push, by mistake, pushed the Block ad on this website and clicked on the main banner region I could easy and without any special knowledge undo my problem. That is why I've used the Adguard reset on my PC, but that did not worked. > > I saw that when I order something, sometimes when the pay section of the site is on display, on PC the screen is just white and I can't finish to process my payments. This I don't know if it's because of Adguard or not but it just became a problem in the past week, out of the blue. > > Thank you. Have a good day! ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Hello,
As far as I can see, most of these banners are loaded from ad servers, like `googlesyndication.com`, `doubleclick.net`, so it rather shouldn't be unblocked.

I have added a rule (filters update should be available in 1-2 hours) which should cause that banners which are not loaded by ad servers should be displayed (like on a screenshot below), but clearing cache or refreshing website using `Ctrl+F5` might be required.
<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/190336064-b0ca3e93-63ba-47c2-80a4-2879616c4656.png)

</details>

If you want to see banners from ad servers then please disable protection on this website.

comment.body:
> It looks like that something doesn't work correctly and probably server with filters is blocked. To be honest I don't what's the reason, but for example it might be similar situation like here - [AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension#2185](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2185)
> 
> You can try to add these rules:
> 
> ```
> @@||imasdk.googleapis.com/js/sdkloader/ima3_dai.js$domain=cbs.com|paramountplus.com
> @@||pubads.g.doubleclick.net/ondemand/*/content/*/vid/*/streams$domain=cbs.com|paramountplus.com
> ||pubads.g.doubleclick.net/ondemand/*/content/*/vid/*/streams/*/time-events.json$important,domain=cbs.com|paramountplus.com
> cbs.com,paramountplus.com#%#(()=>{window.XMLHttpRequest.prototype.open=new Proxy(window.XMLHttpRequest.prototype.open,{apply:async(a,b,c)=>{const d=c[1];return"string"!=typeof d||0===d.length?Reflect.apply(a,b,c):(d.match(/pubads\.g\.doubleclick.net\/ondemand\/hls\/.*\.m3u8/)&&b.addEventListener("readystatechange",function(){if(4===b.readyState){const a=b.response;Object.defineProperty(b,"response",{writable:!0}),Object.defineProperty(b,"responseText",{writable:!0});const c=a.replaceAll(/#EXTINF:(\d|\d\.\d+)\,\nhttps:\/\/redirector\.googlevideo\.com\/videoplayback\?[\s\S]*?&source=dclk_video_ads&[\s\S]*?\n/g,"");b.response=c,b.responseText=c}}),Reflect.apply(a,b,c))}})})();
> cbs.com,paramountplus.com#%#(()=>{const a=window.fetch;window.fetch=new Proxy(window.fetch,{apply:async(b,c,d)=>{const e=d[0];if("string"!=typeof e||0===e.length)return Reflect.apply(b,c,d);if(e.match(/pubads\.g\.doubleclick\.net\/ondemand\/.*\/content\/.*\/vid\/.*\/streams\/.*\/manifest\.mpd|pubads\.g\.doubleclick.net\/ondemand\/hls\/.*\.m3u8/)){const b=await a(...d);let c=await b.text();return c=c.replaceAll(/<Period id="(pre|mid|post)-roll-.-ad-[\s\S]*?>[\s\S]*?<\/Period>|#EXTINF:(\d|\d\.\d+)\,\nhttps:\/\/redirector\.googlevideo\.com\/videoplayback\?[\s\S]*?&source=dclk_video_ads&[\s\S]*?\n/g,""),new Response(c)}return Reflect.apply(b,c,d)}})})();
> ```
> 
> to user rules, but I think it would be better to find out a culprit why this error (with updating filters) occurs.

Okay thanks for your help it means a lot

comment.body:
Установите AdGuard Extra. Это расширение `adblock` не рекомендуется использовать с нашим.

---

Пользователям браузерного расширения нужно установить скрипт `AdGuard Extra`. Для этого понадобится браузерное расширение-скриптоприёмник `Tampermonkey`

Ссылка на `AdGuard Extra`
https://userscripts.adtidy.org/beta/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js

После установки скрипта нужно будет зайти в настройки `Tampermonkey`, включить режим эксперта, переключить режим встраивания на `мгновенный` и перезапустить расширение:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641343-07248e00-b94c-11e9-9775-9854a7922889.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641299-f7a54500-b94b-11e9-8a83-885d89abbeec.png)

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

comment.body:
The task is closed due to a suspicion of spam.

The task is part of a large group of similar issues:
1. It is not critical (the site/application is rarely visited)
2. This whole group of issues is probably created by one person

Unfortunately, we can't afford to handle every such issue. In this case, we may not have enough time to deal with higher priority tasks from AdGuard users.

Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
The task is closed due to a suspicion of spam.

The task is part of a large group of similar issues:
1. It is not critical (the site/application is rarely visited)
2. This whole group of issues is probably created by one person

Unfortunately, we can't afford to handle every such issue. In this case, we may not have enough time to deal with higher priority tasks from AdGuard users.

Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
@sakura1481 Добрый день! С базовым фильтром реклама на этом сайте не повторилась. 

Пожалуйста, попробуйте переустановить сертификат в приложении AdGuard. Настройки - сеть - переустановить сертификат.

Так же проблема может возникать из-за [особенностей совместимости Яндекс Браузера и AdGuard](https://kb.adguard.com/ru/windows/solving-problems/yandex-warning). 

Для лучшей фильтрации можно включить рекомендованные фильтры. Для сайта vk.com это русский языковой фильтр и фильтр раздражителей.

issue.title: Get rid of temporary rules

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

issue.body:
These rules can be found by `^!.*temporary` in Vscode(turn on regexp search option).

I should we do:
- if a temporary rule is not relevant(or not required anymore) and does not need to be replaced - it should be deleted
- if it needs to be replaced and the solution is supported by release versions of Adgard - replace and move to regular rules (or delete a comment if the rule is not in a group)
- if the solution is not supported in the release versions - update the comment and add a check date, for example ! checked xx.xx.2022 comment
- if you are not sure what to do with any rule - feel free to ask in chat

`TODO`'s are the next step.

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
If I'm not wrong these ad leftovers occurs only after redirection (after 30 seconds).
This should block them:
```adblock
sportswatcher.xyz##.adsbyvli[data-ad-slot]
```

And to block redirection, something like:
```adblock
||sportswatcher.xyz^$removeheader=refresh
```

comment.body:
These rules:
```adblock
sportswatcher.xyz#@#.adsbygoogle
sportswatcher.xyz#@#.adsbyvli
sportswatcher.xyz#%#//scriptlet("prevent-setTimeout", "ad-modal")
sportswatcher.xyz###id-custom_banner
```
should fix adblock detection and ad leftover at the bottom.

issue.body:
## Prerequisites ### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms - [x] This is not an ad/bug report; - [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project; - [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes; - [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. ## What problem does the pull request fix? ### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section - [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers; - [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly; - [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website; - [ ] Missed analytics or tracker; - [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc; - [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc; - [x] Filters maintenance. ## What issue is being fixed? ### Enter the issue address NO.1 - https://www.itmedia.co.jp/news/articles/2209/12/news183.html NO.2 - https://www.itmedia.co.jp/business/articles/2209/13/news008.html ### Add your comment and screenshots ・Ad 1 - `itmedia.co.jp##div[id^="ITR"]` 2 - `itmedia.co.jp###cmsSubPR` https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/129596#discussion_r972239648 ・Self-promo https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/129596#discussion_r972223323 3.1 - `###ITT` 3.2 - `###RANKTXT`
